title: The Gospel of Matthew Presentation
notes:
The students will use the 8 guidelines given in class to create a slide show presentation about their assigned scripture.
The students will be graded based on turning it in on time and being prepared (10 Points),¬† the quality of the slides (10 Points), their knowledge of the scripture (10 Points), and their ability to engage the audience (10 Points).

title: All About Me
notes:
1-Slide Slide Show

Using only 1 slide, create a slide show that represents you. You can use pictures, words, memes, emojis (all appropriate, of course) or anything else that this 1 slide can hold. Be creative and tell Mr. A all about YOU!

title: Test 2 Review
notes:
Review:
Pg 44. (36,38, 41 a&b)
Pg. 88-89 (2-10 even, 12-21 all, 24-33 all)

Notes:
1. Add and subtract Integers (no calculator portion)
2. Graph ordered pairs on a coordinate plane
3. Write the ordered pair that is provided on a graph
4. Use <, > or =
5.Absolute Value (single value or used in an expression)
6. Express relation as a table, graph and identify the domain and range
7. 2 Word problems (create an algebraic expression and determine the value of y)

title: Test 1 Review Questions and Components
notes:
Test 1 Review Questions and Components

REVIEW (1:1-4)
Problem Solving
Words and Expressions
Variables
Properties of Numbers
HW ¬†Page 36 (45-48 all)
Page 42 (2, 5-12)
Page 43 (14-30 even)

Review Components

1. Evaluate the Expressions and Solve (Remember Order of Operations)

2. Convert verbal phrases to numerical expressions

3. Convert Verbal phrases to algebraic expressions

4. Evaluate each expression when algebraic value is known

5. Write and evaluate a written expression (numerical)

6. Properties of Addition and Multiplication/Number Properties

7. Write an algebraic expression using known facts.

title: Poem #6 - Warm-Up Poem
notes:
Please label your document title as: Poem #6 - Warm-Up Poem

Remember to include a short reflection - this does not have to be very lengthy, I just need to see that you have given thought to your writing process.

Things to consider when writing your reflection:
What was your thought process as you wrote your first draft? What were you hoping to achieve with this piece?
What kind of feedback did you receive in peer review?
What did your revision process look like?


You must also submit this on TurnItIn.
